page.title: 20Sunderland Point/Changes
page.content: Two severe storms in the last l0 years, causing considerable damage at Sunderland Point, lead residents to await anxiously the next one. There is little scope for improving the protection to the village. Any global change which would cause a significant rise in sea level would make the village untenable. The new Heysham nuclear power stations are about 5 kms. from the village. The construction and operation have created some employment in the village, but there is a widespread unease in a community so close to the sea about the safety of the nuclear plants and in particular the effects of radioactive discharges to the sea from the stations and from the reprocessing plant at Sellafield. Salmon fishing faces increasing competition from farmed salmon.
